abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Second Municipal Development Project for Colombia, a
            project to build the institutional capacity of FINDETER, an
            agency which rediscounts loans and offers technical
            assistance; finances investments in urban infrastructure;
            and builds the capacity of municipalities to provide public
            services. The following impacts and mitigations are
            described. Municipal waste management systems or sanitary
            landfills will dispose of solid waste, mainly debris, and
            domestic waste. Hazardous waste will be stored, reused, or
            recycled. Sediments will be prevented from contaminating
            water bodies. Liquid wastes will be diverted to septic
            tanks, lagoons, infiltration fields, or municipal wastewater
            systems.  Rainwater or running water will be stored or used
            in irrigation or for animals. Covering transport vehicles,
            using storage facilities, restricting vehicle operation,
            prohibiting flammable and scrap materials (litter), and
            periodically cleaning public sites bordering the works will
            reduce air emissions. Establishing greenbelt zones,
            reforestation, and replacing vegetal cover will reduce
            erosion as will restoring removed topsoil, to be used to
            spur vegetative growth. Important plants will be extracted
            and stored for later replanting. Drains or barriers will be
            erected to mitigate erosion.
